_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:35:38 using v2.0
title: What are the rates of employment in England?
analysis_commentary:
The rate of employment in England has decreased by roughly 1% from Quarter 4 2006/2007 to Quarter 4 2012/2013. However, we see positive improvements in the rate of employment for people with mental illness.

Despite a dip in Quarter 1 2011/2012 and since the introduction of the 'work, recovery and inclusion' strategy at the end of 2009, the rate of employment for people with mental illness has generally been increasing. In Quarter 4 2012/2013 this was 32.4% which was an increase of 5.8% from Quarter 4 2006/2007, this is an average increase of roughly 1% a year.
data_source: Office for National Statistics, Labour Force Survey
